summary: This document is an email chain from October 2019 between FBI personnel discussing victim services referrals for victims of Jeffrey Epstein located in West Palm Beach, Florida. It reveals internal coordination to find trauma-focused, vetted counseling resources for victims affected by Epstein's suicide and media attention.

events.title: Epstein's suicide and media impact on victims
events.description: Reference to Jeffrey Epstein's suicide and the subsequent negative impact on victims, including constant visits from reporters to a victim's house, causing distress and a need for counseling.

keyFacts: FBI personnel were actively coordinating victim services for Epstein victims in October 2019, following his suicide.
A specific victim in West Palm Beach was distressed by Epstein's suicide and constant media attention at her home, prompting a request for counseling services.
Internal FBI guidance emphasized referring victims only to trauma-focused and vetted service agencies due to the sensitive nature of the case.
The email chain shows communication between multiple FBI personnel (with redacted names) regarding resource vetting and victim outreach.
Referenced service agencies included Catholic Charities, Palm Beach County Victim Services, and the International Rescue Committee (which was noted to have a human trafficking grant).
